verses.text: Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may have free course, and be glorified, even as it is with you:

similars.text: Hear the word of the Lord, ye that tremble at his word; Your brethren that hated you, that cast you out for my name's sake, said, Let the Lord be glorified: but he shall appear to your joy, and they shall be ashamed.
Brethren, pray for us.

verses.text: And that we may be delivered from unreasonable and wicked men: for all men have not faith.

similars.text: They answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.

verses.text: But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.

similars.text: Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.
The Lord will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

Therefore, be not afraid of your enemies, for I have decreed in my heart, saith the Lord, that I will prove you in all things, whether you will abide in my covenant, even unto death, that you may be found worthy.
The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.
He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.
For the Lord shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
The Lord shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
And that you be firm in keeping the commandments wherewith I have commanded you; and if you do this, behold I grant unto you eternal life, even if you should be slain.
All thy commandments are faithful: they persecute me wrongfully; help thou me.

If ye will fear the Lord, and serve him, and obey his voice, and not rebel against the commandment of the Lord, then shall both ye and also the king that reigneth over you continue following the Lord your God:
Who is among you that feareth the Lord, that obeyeth the voice of his servant, that walketh in darkness, and hath no light? let him trust in the name of the Lord, and stay upon his God.
He that is faithful and endureth shall overcome the world.

Now ye see that this is the true faith of God; yea, ye see that God will support, and keep, and preserve us, so long as we are faithful unto him, and unto our faith, and our religion; and never will the Lord suffer that we shall be destroyed except we should fall into transgression and deny our faith.
Keep me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.
For I will surely deliver thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword, but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee: because thou hast put thy trust in me, saith the Lord.
Know therefore that the Lord thy God, he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth covenant and mercy with them that love him and keep his commandments to a thousand generations;
Deliver me, O Lord, from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;
Therefore thou shalt keep the commandments of the Lord thy God, to walk in his ways, and to fear him.
Then will I stablish the throne of thy kingdom, according as I have covenanted with David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man to be ruler in Israel.
Nevertheless, all flesh is in mine hand, and he that is faithful among you shall not perish by the waters.
Thou shalt fear the Lord thy God, and serve him, and shalt swear by his name.
The Lord is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he knoweth them that trust in him.
The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.
For the Lord shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
The Lord is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he knoweth them that trust in him.
And the Lord shall help them, and deliver them: he shall deliver them from the wicked, and save them, because they trust in him.

verses.text: And we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that ye both do and will do the things which we command you.

similars.text: For the Lord shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.
I have confidence in you through the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment, whosoever he be.
And we will prove them herewith, to see if they will do all things whatsoever the Lord their God shall command them;
And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:
For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

verses.text: And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.

similars.text: Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh.

verses.text: Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother that walketh disorderly, and not after the tradition which he received of us.

similars.text: And now, I say unto you, my brethren, that after ye have known and have been taught all these things, if ye should transgress and go contrary to that which has been spoken, that ye do withdraw yourselves from the Spirit of the Lord, that it may have no place in you to guide you in wisdom's paths that ye may be blessed, prospered, and preserved--
And now, a commandment I give unto you concerning Zion, that you shall no longer be bound as a united order to your brethren of Zion, only on this wise--
And inasmuch as thy brethren shall rebel against thee, they shall be cut off from the presence of the Lord.
Now we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by our gathering together unto him,
Furthermore then we beseech you, brethren, and exhort you by the Lord Jesus, that as ye have received of us how ye ought to walk and to please God, so ye would abound more and more.

verses.text: For yourselves know how ye ought to follow us: for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you;

similars.text: Not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.

verses.text: Neither did we eat any man's bread for nought; but wrought with labour and travail night and day, that we might not be chargeable to any of you:

similars.text: For ye remember, brethren, our labour and travail: for labouring night and day, because we would not be chargeable unto any of you, we preached unto you the gospel of God.

verses.text: Not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.

similars.text: For yourselves know how ye ought to follow us: for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you;

verses.text: For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat.
For we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderly, working not at all, but are busybodies.
Now them that are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread.
But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.

similars.text: For yourselves, brethren, know our entrance in unto you, that it was not in vain:
Wherefore, be not weary in well-doing, for ye are laying the foundation of a great work. And out of small things proceedeth that which is great.
And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye steadfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.

verses.text: And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man, and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed.

similars.text: I speak to your shame. Is it so, that there is not a wise man among you? no, not one that shall be able to judge between his brethren?

verses.text: Yet count him not as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.

similars.text: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother's way.
Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour, and not suffer sin upon him.

verses.text: Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means. The Lord be with you all.

similars.text: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
The Lord lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
For my brethren and companions' sakes, I will now say, Peace be within thee.
And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
The Lord lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.

verses.text: The salutation of Paul with mine own hand, which is the token in every epistle: so I write.

similars.text: The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.
The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.
I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

Therefore I have written this epistle, sealing it with mine own hand, feeling for your welfare, because of your firmness in that which ye believe to be right, and your noble spirit in the field of battle.
The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.
The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.
The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

similars.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
Grace be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, be with you all. Amen.
Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen.
All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
And this according to the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, to whom be all glory, both now and forever. Amen.
Grace be with you, mercy, and peace, from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.

And may the grace of God the Father, whose throne is high in the heavens, and our Lord Jesus Christ, who sitteth on the right hand of his power, until all things shall become subject unto him, be, and abide with you forever. Amen.
To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ which are at Colosse: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Blessed be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity. Peace be with you all that are in Christ Jesus. Amen.
But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.
The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.
Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,
Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
And behold, and lo, I am with you to bless you and deliver you forever. Amen.
Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Therefore, be faithful; and behold, and lo, I am with you even unto the end. Even so. Amen.
To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever. Amen.

And now, I would commend you to seek this Jesus of whom the prophets and apostles have written, that the grace of God the Father, and also the Lord Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost, which beareth record of them, may be and abide in you forever. Amen.
Verily, thus saith the Lord your God, your Redeemer, even Jesus Christ. Amen.
Behold, the kingdom is yours. And behold, and lo, I am with the faithful always. Even so. Amen.
Behold the Lord your God hath spoken it. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
